page.title: 19Changing Times.School 1985.
page.content: There are about 90 children in 4 classes with a special unit for partially hearing children.The catchment area includes Beal,Fenwick, and Warenford.The deaf children come from as far away as Amble.Free transport is provided for most of the children living out of Belford.The infant children are allowed to talk and move freely in class and may play with toys once they have finished their work.They watch schools progammes on a colour T.V.,listen to the radio and have regular access to a computer.They take their reading books home every night and have the use of County Library books housed in the school.The 2 older classes travel to Berwick Swimming Pool every Wednesday morning.Parents help with needlework and games and are welcome in school to discuss any problems their child has.
